children.name: to make a loud high noise
scream b1
children.definition: scream to make a loud high noise with your voice because you are hurt, frightened, excited etcsyn shriek: la hét
examples: after the first few shots, people started screaming.
a screaming baby
scream with/in
she jumped to her feet, screaming in terror.
he was draggedkicking and screamingto a nearby van.
scream loudlyi just screamed as loudly as i could.
scream wildly(= in a loud and uncontrolled way )poor george, screaming wildly, was carried upstairs by his father.
scream hysterically(= in a completely uncontrolled way )some of the girls started screaming hysterically.
scream with laughter/delightshe threw her head back and screamed with laughter.
scream in/with painwe could hear her screaming in pain.
scream in terror/agony etche screamed in fear and panic, and banged frantically on the door.
scream your head off(= scream a lot )at least the idiot wasn’t panicking and screaming his head off.
scream blue murderinformal(= scream very loudly with fear or anger )she flew into a rage and screamed blue murder at him.

children.name: shriek x
children.definition: shriek to make a very high loud sound, especially because you are afraid, angry, excited, or in painsyn scream: la hét
examples: they were dragged from their homes, shrieking and weeping.
he shrieked in agony.
shriek with excitement/laughter/fear etc
the children began shrieking with hysterical laughter.
a group of students were shrieking with laughter.

children.name: screech x
children.definition: screech to shout loudly in an unpleasant high voice because you are angry, afraid, or excited:rét lên, rít lên
examples: sue grabbed him, screeching, and started hitting him with her fists.
‘get out!’ she screeched angrily. ‘i hate you!’
‘look out!’ she screeched.
theyscreeched with laughter.
screech at
maria suddenly started screeching at bruno.
she screeched at me to take off my muddy shoes.

children.name: squeal x
children.definition: squeal to make a sudden very high screaming sound, because you are excited, amused, frightened, or in pain:ré lên
examples: the children squealed and fought among themselves.
‘don’t you dare!’ bobby squealed.
‘let me go!’ she squealed.
squeal with excitement/laughter/delight/pain etc
the boy squealed with pain and surprise.
they all tumbled into the water, squealing with delight.
the children squealed with delight.

children.name: yelp x
children.definition: yelp to give a short cry, especially because you have just been hurt:hét lên
examples: the boy grinned, and then yelped as someone hit him in the back.
sophie yelped with pain and dropped the pan.

children.name: shout a2
children.definition: shoutukto call out loudlysyn scream:
examples: shout in pain/anger/frustration etc
al shouted in pain.

children.name: shout a2
children.definition: shout to say sth very loudly, because you want to make sure that sb hears you, or because you are angry or excited →scream,yell:
examples: there’s no need to shout! i can hear you!
shout at
i wish you’d stop shouting at the children.
shout for
we could hear themshouting for help.
‘watch out!’ she shouted, as the car started to move.
shout sth at sb
he was shouting insults at the lorry driver.
shout sth to sb
‘he’s down here!’ she shouted to alison.
shout sth out/shout out sth
linda leant out of the widow and shouted out my name.
shout abuse/insultshe was surrounded by a group of boys who shouted abuse at him.
shout obscenitiesthey came to his apartment, shouting obscenities and threatening him.
shout slogansthey were carrying placards and shouting slogans.
shout ordersthe lieutenant was shouting orders at the workmen.
shout sb’s namethen she heard ferdinando shout her name.
shout a warningthe man had shouted a warning to other passengers just before the blast.
shout for helpi opened my mouth to shout for help.
shout sth angrily‘don’t touch me!’ he shouted angrily.
shout sth loudlyhe hears the voice of his downstairs neighbor shouting loudly.
shout yourself hoarse(= shout until your throat is sore )matthew shouted himself hoarse until he was discovered.
shout of the top of your voice(= shout as loudly as possible )'watch out!' he shouted at the top of his voice.
scream and shoutpeople were screaming and shouting in the streets.

children.name: yell b2
children.definition: yell to shout very loudly, for example because you are very angry or excited, or because you want to get someone’s attention.yellis more informal thanshout:hét (ít trang trọng)
examples: ‘don’t touch me,’ she yelled.
the music blaring in the bar was forcing us both to yell to be heard.
yell at
the children were yelling at each other across the street.
don’t you yell at me like that!
yell at sb to do sth
they yelled at him to stop.
yell (out) in surprise/pain etc
clare yelled in pain as she fell.
he could hear pete yellingat the top ofhisvoice(= very loudly ).
yell out sth/yell sth out
he opened the door and yelled out ‘anybody home?’

children.name: scream b1
children.definition: scream (alsoscream out) to shout sth in a very loud high voice because you are angry or frightenedsyn yell:hét lên
examples: ‘get out!’ she screamed.
he screamed out her name.
scream for
i screamed for help.
scream at
he screamed at her to go away.
the crowd continued toscream abuseat him.
maria felt like screaming at her husband.

children.name: raise your voice u
children.definition: raise your voice to speak more loudly than usual because you are angry about sth: lớn tiếng
examples: i never heard my father raise his voice in his life.
raise your voice at/to
don’t you raise your voice at me!
raised voicesthe sound ofpeople talking loudly because they are angry
we heard raised voices coming from the next room, and then a cry.

children.name: cry b1
children.definition: cry written to shout sth loudly, especially because you are feeling strong emotions such as pain or excitement: kêu lên
examples: ‘i can’t move,’ lesley cried. ‘i think i’ve broken my leg.
‘come and see what i’ve found!’ kurt cried.
cry out[i] written c2
‘careful!’ she cried out. ‘there’s a snake!’
cry out in fear/pain/surprise etc
chris fell, crying out in pain.

children.name: roar c2
children.definition: roarwrittento shout in a loud deep voicebecause you are extremely angry or want to frighten sb:gầm lên
examples: suddenly the teacher roared my name across the classroom.
‘you idiot!’ he roared.
roar at
‘get down and don’t move,’ the man roared at her.

children.name: bawl x
children.definition: bawl to shout very loudly and rudely in order to make sure that people hear what you are saying:nói, la oang oang
examples: ‘stop that thief!’ he bawled at the top of his voice.
one of the prison guards was bawling orders across the yard.
bawl at
that couple next door are always shouting and bawling at each other.

children.name: bellow x
children.definition: bellowwrittento shout in a loud deep voice, especially when you want a lot of people to hear you : rống lên
examples: he was bellowing orders at the soldiers.
‘be quiet!’ the teacher bellowed.
the officer in charge was bellowing instructions through a loudspeaker
bellow at
then the referee started to blow his whistle and bellow at me.

children.name: shriek x
children.definition: shriek to say something in a high loud voice because you are excited, afraid, or angrysyn scream: hét lên
examples: ‘i’m pregnant,’ she shrieked.
shriek at
‘i’ll kill you,’ anne shrieked at him.
the two women shrieked at one another over the noise of the machines.

children.name: shout b1
children.definition: shout a loud call that expresses anger, excitement etc, or is made in order to get sb’s attention: tiếng la hét
examples: as we got near the stadium, we could hear the shouts of the crowd.
an angry shout
her speech was interrupted by angry shouts from the audience.
a shout of excitement/joy/pleasure etc
just then angie burst in with a shout of excitement.
give a shout
he gave a shout of joy as he realised he’d won the race.

children.name: scream b1
children.definition: scream a sudden loud shout or cry that expresses fear, excitement etc:tiếng la hét
examples: we could hear screams coming from the burning building.
we heard screams coming from the flat.
a scream of fear/pain/delight etc
a gun went off, and i heard a scream of fear from inside the room.
a loud screamsuddenly i heard a loud scream.
a shrill/piercing/high-pitched scream(= with a very high sound )the sound of gunfire mingled with the shrill screams of the injured.
a bloodcurdling scream(= very frightening )with a blood-curdling scream, he threw himself at paul.
a terrified scream(= by someone who is terrified )i let out a terrified scream and scuttled down the stairs.
a terrible scream(= by someone suffering great pain or fear )we were woken late that night by the most terrible screams.
a little screammrs wood gave a little scream.
a muffled/stifled scream(= made quieter, for example by putting a hand over someone’s mouth)no one heard her muffled screams.
let out a screamhe let out a piercing scream.
give a screamshe gave a scream of delight.
a scream of laughter/delightwe could hear the children’s screams of laughter.
a scream of pain/terror/agonymy screams of terror awoke my parents.

children.name: yell b2
children.definition: yell a very loud shout that expresses great anger, excitement etc or is made in order to get sb’s attention:tiếng la lớn
examples: a great yell went up from the crowd. liverpool had scored.
a loud/great yell
suddenly there was a loud/great yell from the bathroom.
a yell of alarm/fear/anger/ surprise/delight/triumph etc
steve could no longer prevent a yell of frustration.
dan gave a yell of delight when larsson scored.
give/let out a yell
christine gave a yell of alarm as blood spurted from the wound
she let out a yell when she saw me.

children.name: roar c2
children.definition: roar a very loud deep shout, especially one that expresses anger, pain, amusement, or excitement:tiếng gầm thét
examples: i love to hear the roar of the crowd at a blue jays baseball game.
a roar of anger/pain/laughter etc
there were roars of laughter coming from the living room.
i shall never forget his roar of anguish on hearing the terrible news.

children.name: cry b1
children.definition: cry a shouted word or phrase :tiếng kêu la
examples: cry of
as they left the stage there were cries of ‘more! more!’
at last, there was a cry of ‘silence!’, and everyone looked towards the door.
cry for
cry for helpsth sb says or does that shows that they are very unhappy and need help :
i think taking the pills was a cry for help.
we heard a child’s cries for help coming from the river.
fortunately, a passerby heard hiscries for help.

children.name: cheer c2
children.definition: cheer a shout of happiness, praise, approval, or encouragementopp boo: tiếng reo hò, cổ vũ
examples: a deafening cheer rose from the crowd as the band walked onto the stage.
the final whistle was greeted with triumphant cheers from players and spectators.
give a cheer
let’s all give a big cheer for the newly married couple! hip, hip, hooray!
so let’sgive a cheerto the kids who passed their exams.
a cheer goes up
a greatcheer went upfrom the crowd.

children.name: shriek x
children.definition: shriek a loud high sound made because you are frightened, excited, angry etc :tiếng la hét
examples: i was woken up by a loud shriek from the bathroom.
a shriek of delight/laughter
with a shriek of delight, she threw herself into the water.
almost before he started speaking they all burst into shrieks of laughter.
with a shriek
with a shriek of delight, jean hugged maggie.
give/let out a shriek
ella let out a piercing shriek.

children.name: squeal x
children.definition: squeal a sudden high screaming sound, when frightened or excited:tiếng kêu ré lên
examples: suddenly there was a bump and an awful squeal.
squeals of delight/joy/laughter etc
the sight of the food brought squeals of delight from the children.
she gave a squeal of laughter.
there was a squeal of brakes.

children.name: yelp x
children.definition: yelp a short sharp high cry which you make, especially because you have just been hurt
examples: give/let out a yelp of pain/dismay/surprise etc
the water was hotter than she had expected, and she gave an involuntary yelp.
she jumped back from the fire with a sudden yelp of pain.

children.name: to say sth suddenly or unexpectedly
exclaim c2
children.definition: exclaim to say something suddenly and loudly because you are angry, surprised, or excited:kêu lên, la lên
examples: ‘what a beautiful house!’ she exclaimed.
‘aha'!', he exclaimed triumphantly. ’we knew you’d come".

children.name: come out with x
children.definition: come out with to suddenly say sth, in an unplanned way, which other people find unusual or surprising:thốt lên
examples: it was strange to hear a little old lady come out with a swear word like that.
i don’t want to make a speech -- i’ll only come out with something stupid that everyone will laugh at.
you never know what he’ll come out with next.

children.name: blurt out x
children.definition: blurt out to suddenly say sth without thinking, especially sth embarrassing or sth that should be kept secret: thốt ra, buột miệng nói ra
examples: she had blurted out my secret when she was upset, and now everyone knew about it.
he couldn’t go through the agony of lying to them again, so he blurted everything out.
blurt out that
she couldn’t think of a good excuse, so blurted out that she was pregnant.

children.name: cheer b2
children.definition: cheer to shout as a way of showing happiness, approval, or support of sb or sth: hoan hô, cổ vũ
examples: at the end, the whole audience stood up clapping and cheering.
the crowd cheered when the band came on stage.
cheer for
i saw the way the crowd cheered for him, and i thought, ‘i want to be like that!’
cheer sbuk
the speaker was cheered loudly when he called for a total ban on nuclear weapons.
cheer sb onencourage sb to do sth by cheering them as they do it
all the mums and dads come to cheer their kids on.

children.name: bark c2
children.definition: bark/ bark out to shout at someone in a forceful manner :quát tháo
examples: the sergeant barked(out)a succession of orders to the new recruits.
bark at
‘don’t just stand there, give me a hand,’ she barked at the shop assistant.

children.name: to say sth very loudly to get sb's attention
hail c2
children.definition: hail slightly formal to call to sb in order to greet them or try to attract their attention :gọi
examples: she leaned out of the window and hailed a passerby.
i tried to hail her from across the room.
hail a cab/taxi
the hotel doorman will hail a cab for you.
shall we hail a taxi?

children.name: call b1
children.definition: call to shout loudly because you want to get sb’s attention, to let sb know where you are etc: gọi, hú
examples: did you call?
"hey, you! come over here!" she called.
someone in the crowd called his name.
just call me if you need anything. i’m right here.
call out[i or m]
‘is there anybody there?’ he called out, but there was no reply.
she called out his name but he didn’t look back.
call out for
i thought i heard someone calling for help.
call out to
the prisoners used to call out to each other from their cells.
